intro: Ipomoea minuta, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering vine native to tropical and subtropical regions. It produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, typically blooming in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy and can grow up to 10 centimeters in length. Its stems are trailing and can spread quickly, making it a common weed in cultivated areas. Ipomoea minuta is also known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
